qas.question: What type of food is Armenian food most similair to?
What does Armenian cuisine place an emphasis on?
What does Armenian cuisine use to create its distinctive dishes?

answers.text: various spices, vegetables, fish, and fruits

qas.question: What different uses does fruit have in Armenian food?

answers.text: main ingredient as well as to sour food

context: Armenian cuisine is as ancient as the history of Armenia, a combination of different tastes and aromas. The food often has quite a distinct aroma. Closely related to <a0_0>eastern and Mediterranean cuisine<a0_0/>, <a2_0>various spices, vegetables, fish, and fruits<a2_0/> combine to present unique dishes. The main characteristics of Armenian cuisine are a reliance on the <a1_0>quality of the ingredients<a1_0/> rather than heavily spicing food, the use of herbs, the use of wheat in a variety of forms, of legumes, nuts, and fruit (as a <a3_0>main ingredient as well as to sour food<a3_0/>), and the stuffing of a wide variety of leaves.
